description.narrative:
In 2014, Mumberes got a loan to acquire a 10,000 liter cooler. Milk volumes increased to an average of 9,325 kgs per day; the members increased their milk deliveries by an average 1,700 kgs/day (>21%) last year. Total number of members increased to 1,445.
This was due to good management, farmer trainings, farmer loyalty, prompt payments and stable milk price as well. Side selling has also reduced and in fact some hawkers near the cooperative have been forced to close shop due to lack of raw milk from the farmer.
Continuation of efforts on extension services is needed to remain and further increase volumes of milk intake.
Activities as jointly identified with Mumberes for action plan 2014:
Increase Production (supported also by SNV) through training and extension Improve feed production - Improve Extension Services to members to a) increase amounts of feed input per cow per day and b) stimulate member commitment to dairy farming as a business. Have Hillary explain and discuss feed cost/milk price ratios. Build the redesigned/modernized 0-grazing unit on cooler location Demo on hay production on 10 acre rented land.
Improve essential services - Organize simple Agro-Vet services to be delivered to members on check off and who do NOT have access to them in their area. Performance management - Training of Board members on a) Governance and b) Focus in business (single-purpose vs multipurpose) - Start implementation Strategic plan - Exposure visit for Board to another dairy coop with evening milk collection and improved feeding - Establish youth counsel and train them on production (feed, silage, 0-grazing) and governance (basics of cooperatives) - Further optimise collection (logistics) Coop Works - Enlarge number of modules (incl. training) - Finalise plan for milk bar operation (complying with KDB legislation)
Increase production and start implementation of strategic plan
